product_overview: HireByte is an AI-powered mock interview platform that simulates technical interviews with real-time webcam overlay metrics and provides a post-interview analytics report and feedback. Users can configure interview topics and difficulty, run a live AI interview, and review detailed performance analytics.
core_goals: Provide a realistic, adaptive AI interviewer that accepts voice/text and returns TTS/text responses.
Deliver low-latency real-time webcam overlays showing Confidence, Focus, and Emotion during interviews.
Generate a comprehensive post-interview analytics report and actionable AI feedback.
Make onboarding simple with quick setup (topic + difficulty) and guest or account entry.
Ensure reliability and clear error handling for permissions, API failures, and analytics retrieval.

features.name: Onboarding & Setup
features.description: Allow users to start a guest session or login, then select interview topic and difficulty before launching an interview.
user_flows: Navigate to / -> Click Start as Guest -> Navigate to /setup -> Select Interview Topic 'Python' -> Select Difficulty 'Medium' -> Click Start Interview -> Navigate to /interview
Navigate to / -> Click Login -> (if login present) Fill credentials -> Click Submit -> See login success and Navigate to /setup

Navigate to / -> Click Start as Guest -> Navigate to /setup -> Leave topic unselected -> Click Start Interview -> See validation error 'Please select a topic' -> Select Topic -> Click Start Interview -> Navigate to /interview

features.name: Interview Session
features.description: Run the live AI interview: start session, grant camera/mic, interact by speaking, receive real-time prompts and finish the session.
user_flows: Navigate to /interview -> Click Start Interview (triggers POST /api/interview/start) -> POST /api/interview/start returns 200 -> Grant camera/mic permissions -> See webcam overlay with live metrics -> Hear AI ask first question -> Speak answers -> View real-time hints -> Click Done to finish -> See 'Processing results' and redirect to /analytics

Navigate to /interview -> Click Start Interview (triggers POST /api/interview/start) -> POST /api/interview/start returns 500 -> See error 'Unable to start interview' -> Click Retry -> POST /api/interview/start returns 200 -> Continue with interview

Navigate to /interview -> Click Start Interview -> Grant camera/mic permissions -> Deny camera/mic permissions -> See permissions denied modal -> Click Retry Permissions -> Browser prompts for camera/mic again

features.name: Real-time Analysis & Hints
features.description: Display live analysis metrics (confidence, focus, emotion) overlayed on video and provide context-aware hints (Small/Medium/Full) on demand.
user_flows: Navigate to /interview -> Grant camera/mic permissions -> See webcam overlay showing Confidence, Focus, Emotion metrics updating in real time -> Click 'Hint (Small)' -> Receive Small hint contextualized to current transcript
Navigate to /interview -> Grant camera/mic permissions -> See webcam overlay -> Click 'Hint (Full)' -> Request hint from server -> Server returns hint -> Display full contextual hint panel

Navigate to /interview -> Grant camera/mic permissions -> See webcam overlay -> Click 'Hint (Small)' -> Hint API returns 502 -> Show 'Hint unavailable, try again' notification -> Allow user to continue without hint

features.name: Analytics Dashboard & Feedback Report
features.description: Provide a post-interview analytics dashboard with readiness ring, topic mastery visuals, reasoning metrics, AI feedback, and an option to export a PDF report.
user_flows: Navigate to /analytics -> GET /api/analytics is called -> GET /api/analytics returns 200 with report data -> View scores and charts (Readiness Ring, Topic Mastery Radar, Reasoning Density) -> Click View AI Feedback -> Read detailed strengths and improvements -> Click Export PDF report -> Receive PDF download
Navigate to /analytics -> GET /api/analytics is called -> GET /api/analytics returns 500 -> See 'Unable to load analytics' message -> Click Retry -> GET /api/analytics returns 200 -> View analytics
Navigate to /analytics -> GET /api/analytics returns 200 -> Click Export PDF report -> PDF generation fails -> Show 'Export failed, try again later' and provide 'Email report' fallback option
